biography.value:
A liondrake is a solitary and territorial predator with the long neck and wings of a brass dragon and the head and body of a lion (including a luxurious mane on males). Sometimes known as dragonnes, liondrakes rely on their ferocity and their frightful roar to overcome prey and drive off rivals.

Liondrakes are voracious hunters that range across well-established territories. They don’t typically seek out people as prey, but those folk who encroach into liondrake territory are fair game—which feeds the creature’s reputation as hungering for Humanoid flesh.

description.value:
The liondrake makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 2d10 + @mod type=piercing average=true]] damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a [[/save str 15 format=long]] or be knocked &Reference[prone]{prone}.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 2d6 + @mod type=slashing average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

The liondrake lets out a terrifying roar audible out to 300 feet. Any creature within 30 feet of the liondrake that can hear its roar must succeed on a [[/save wis 14 format=long]] or be &Reference[frightened]{frightened} of the liondrake for 1 minute. A creature that fails the save by 5 or more is also &Reference[paralyzed]{paralyzed} for the same duration. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target’s saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to this liondrake’s Blood-Chilling Roar for the next 24 hours.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.
